result.execSummary:
The defendant Markell Hogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Markell Hogan was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Markell Hogan is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Markell Hogan was found guilty of Human Trafficking [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.302(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia
Have no unsupervised contact with female juveniles
No contact directly or indirectly with the victims
Not to engage in romantic or dating relationship without approval of agent

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent
Sign all releases for agent
